cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 miles SW of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeast across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to sweep across the southeastern United States and emerge off the Atlantic coast of the Carolinas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle, near the Big Bend/Apalachicola–St. Marks area

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to Yankeetown, FL, and Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast of Florida, then the Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible 25–35 mph with low chance (11%) of reaching tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat identified for the Jacksonville Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated amounts near 5 inches possible as the system passes inland to the north
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the Northeast Florida coast
